Brooklyn Historical Society
Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files
Brooklyn Historical Society (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)
ARC.315
18 Linear Feet in 9 filing cabinet drawers
1780-2018 The Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files is an artificial collection compiled by Brooklyn Historical Society staff, that continues to be updated to the present day. The collection contains pamphlets, cards, advertisements, newspaper articles, magazines, letters, and more dating from 1770 to the present documenting Brooklyn, New York City, and Long Island. This collection also includes biographical files on notable Brooklyn individuals. The majority of the materials in English, with additional materials in Spanish, German, Dutch, and Hebrew.
Conditions Governing Access
Open to researchers without restriction.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
The Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files is an artificial collection compiled by the Brooklyn Historical Society staff, that continues to be updated to the present day.
Arrangement
This collection is organized into three series: Series 1. New York City and Long Island, Series 2. Brooklyn, Series 3. Biographical.
Series 1 and 2 are arranged alphabetically by topic, while Series 3 is organized alphabetically by last name.
Biographical / Historical
The Brooklyn Historical Society vertical files is an artificial collection compiled by Brooklyn Historical Society staff, that continues to be updated to the present day.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Historical Society Vertical Files collection, ARC.315, Drawer number and Folder name; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Processing Information
Twenty boxes of material found in repository added to collection by Lena Evers-Hillstrom in September 2018.
Scope and Contents
The collection contains pamphlets, cards, advertisements, newspaper articles, magazines, letters, and more dating from 1770 to the present. The first series documents life in New York City and Long Island, including individual communities, organizations, and events. This series includes materials on counties and boroughs such as Queens, Staten Island, and Suffolk County. The second series documents life in Brooklyn through files on individual neighborhoods, landscapes, organizations, events, local government, and businesses. The third series documents individuals from Brooklyn and Brooklyn-based families. Notable individuals represented in this collection include Walt Whitman, Henry Ward Beecher, Gabriel Furman, Jackie Robinson, and members of the Roebling and Shellens families. This collection also includes information about lesser known organizations and individuals.
Conditions Governing Use
All works published prior to 1923 are in the public domain. The copyright status for all other materials has not been evaluated. Please consult library staff for more information.
